question_sentence: Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine has gained full FDA approval. What’s its brand name?
Starbucks brought back pumpkin spice latte along with what new addition to the chain’s fall menu?
Former President Donald Trump was booed by his supporters at a rally in Alabama after telling them that:
choices: He won’t run for president again.
They should get vaccinated against COVID-19.

question_sentence: Before becoming a drummer for Rolling Stones, Charlie Watts, who died Tuesday at 80, tried to learn which instrument first?
Vice President Kamala Harris' Vietnam visit was delayed by a possible case of Havana syndrome. Which isn’t one of its reported symptoms?
This week, the Baltimore Orioles snapped the longest losing streak in MLB this season. How many consecutive games did they lose?
President Biden issued a warning to those who carried out the attack outside the international airport in Kabul, saying:
choices: "We will hunt you down and make you pay."

question_sentence: Delta Air Lines is planning to do what to workers who refuse to get a COVID-19 vaccination?
choices: Charge an extra $200 for health care insurance

question_sentence: Three major college athletics conferences are reportedly forming an alliance. Which of these is not included in the group?
President Biden is set to meet with the new leader of which nation for the first time this week?
What name have researchers given to a new class of potentially habitable planets?
evidence: The hydrogen-rich and ocean covered planets could host microbial life, according to University of Cambridge researchers.

question_sentence: Which children’s book came under fire this week for depicting ‘harmful gender stereotypes’?
choices: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
evidence: The co-director of a Scottish charity working to end male violence against women claimed that it reinforces dangerous gender stereotypes which in turn reinforce gender inequality

question_sentence: What Christmas dinner favourite could be in short supply this year due to ongoing UK supply chain problems?
evidence: According to Nick Allen, head of the British Meat Processors Association, pigs in blankets could be in short supply this year due to a lack of supply chain staff.

question_sentence: Scientists have predicted that the next global pandemic will likely occur before which year?
evidence: A new study suggests the rate at which outbreaks appear is speeding up, meaning many younger people will most likely live through another pandemic.

question_sentence: Extinction Rebellion has warned of two weeks of protests in London, but what percentage of the British public approve of the activist group and its disruptive tactics?
evidence: The group is fairly unpopular, with 19% of people saying they feel neutral and 35% disapproving of them, according to YouGov.

question_sentence: Which player topped the football rich list in 2021, according to Radio Times?
evidence: The former Barcelona star recently put pen to paper on a deal worth £960,000 a week with French club Paris Saint-Germain.

question_sentence: The Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts died this week aged 80, but what was his job before he joined the band?
evidence: Watts refused to give up his day job until the band signed to record label Decca in 1963.

question_sentence: How many lives has the UK’s vaccination programme saved in the UK, according to Public Health England?
evidence: Vaccines have also prevented more than 24 million infections, according to the Public Health England study.

question_sentence: Which movie star has said that he will not leave his £116m fortune to his daughters?
evidence: The James Bond star told The Sunday Times that the idea of large inheritances are ‘distasteful’, adding that he was not planning to leave ‘great sums’ to either of his daughters.

question_sentence: US Vice-President Kamala Harris delayed her flight to Vietnam after an ‘anomalous health incident’ in the country. What is the name of the suspect illness?
evidence: We discuss the mysterious illness, which has affected US embassy staff in various locations since 2016, on The Week Unwrapped podcast this week.

question_sentence: The FDA granted full approval to the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine this week. What is the new official brand name of the vaccine?
evidence: Some people were puzzled by the vaccine’s brand name, Comirnaty. The moniker is a mashup of “Covid immunity,” “mRNA” and “community.”

question_sentence: A controversial audit of presidential election ballots in this state was delayed after members of the team hired by Republican state senators contracted Covid-19. What state is it? (Hint: It was won by Joe Biden in the 2020 election, hence the audit.)
evidence: The audit focuses on 2.1 million ballots cast in the presidential election in Maricopa County, Arizona. State and national leaders have criticized the audit for its heavily Republican bent, saying the results will be “unreliable.”

question_sentence: Thirteen US service members and at least 90 Afghans were killed in a bombing outside the Kabul airport this week, deepening the crisis sparked by the withdrawal of US troops from the country. An affiliate of which group has taken responsibility for the attack?
evidence: ISIS in Khorasan, also known as ISIS-K, has taken responsibility for the attack. The group has been active in Afghanistan for years, and is an enemy of the Taliban, who now rule in the country.

question_sentence: The Paralympics are underway in Tokyo, featuring some of the world’s best athletes with disabilities. Two new sports are debuting in this year’s games, bringing the total number of Paralympic sports to 22. What two are they?
evidence: Badminton and taekwondo are making their debut in the 2020 Tokyo Paralympics. Judo, rowing and table tennis are already established Paralympic sports.

question_sentence: Pumpkin Spice Lattes are back at Starbucks, and pumpkin-spiced products are sure to be popping up everywhere as fall draws near. What spice is NOT typically part of a traditional “pumpkin spice” blend?
evidence: Pumpkin spice usually contains a blend of ground cinnamon, nutmeg, dry ginger and clove or allspice mixed together. Though, of course, recipes may vary.

question_sentence: “Dancing with the Stars” announced it will feature a same-sex dancing pair for the first time. Which celebrity contestant will be part of the historic duo?
evidence: JoJo Siwa, the teen dancing star who rose to fame on the show “Dance Moms,” will be competing with a female dance pro. Siwa identifies as a member of the LGBTQ+ community.

question_sentence: The CDC has issued a warning over an increase in people ingesting ivermectin. The drug, which is not intended for human consumption, has been touted by right-wing influencers as a treatment for Covid-19. What is ivermectin’s intended use?
evidence: Ivermectin is an anti-parasitic drug used to treat livestock. The CDC says hospital visits and poison control center calls related to the drug have skyrocketed in recent weeks.

question_sentence: Which sport was the center of a major legal decision this week, with the US Department of Justice awarding more than $200 million to the sports’ governing bodies after determining the sport had been overrun by decades of bribery schemes?
evidence: The DOJ awarded $201 million to FIFA and several other international soccer governing groups after concluding long-running bribery schemes had stunted the sport’s development.

question_sentence: Civil rights leaders and thousands of activists are expected to attend a march in Washington, DC this Saturday. What issue is focus of the event?
evidence: Marchers are demanding Congress pass sweeping voting rights legislation to combat attempts at voter suppression. Civil rights leaders aligned the date with the 58th anniversary of the historic March on Washington where Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his famous “I Have a Dream” speech.

question_sentence: A person who appeared on the cover of an iconic 90’s rock album is suing the band, saying it is “child sexual exploitation.” What band is it?
evidence: Spencer Elden is suing Nirvana over the cover of the band’s 1991 album, “Nevermind.” Elden, now 30, appeared as a naked baby on the cover, and claims the work amounts to child pornography.
